segments.text: Why did you invite her here?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why? Does that bother you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's been in New York for three-and-a-half years. She don't just suddenly come and-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, maybe, maybe he just wanted to see her.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You don't travel seven hundred miles just to see.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean? They lived next door to each other their entire lives. Why shouldn't he want to see her? Hey, don't look at me like that. I don't know anymore than you do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He's not going to marry her.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know he's even thinking about it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's got that about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, so what?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's going on here, Joe?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Listen, kid-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not Larry's girl. She knows that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can't read her mind.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Then why is she married? Then why isn't she married? She's been in New York and there's hundreds of single men there.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm sure hundreds of them asked her and told her that she's foolish, but no.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She's waited.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know why she's waited?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because she thinks like me, that's why.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She's faithful as a rock, don't you know. In my worst moments I can think of her-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think again, that I'm-I'm right.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look, it's a nice day. What are we arguing for?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody in my house better ever dare-dare to challenge her faith. Maybe strangers, but not his father, not his brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because he's not coming back. Then what do I got to live for? I'll kill myself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't, don't laugh at me, don't laugh at me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look at it. Because why, when she came here and she slept in his room, the memorial broke into pieces. Look at it, look at it, Joe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right. All right. Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You got to believe, believe with me because I can't stand all alone.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Okay. Just calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, you've got to believe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Believe, Joe. You above all people have got to believe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why me, above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Huh?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You got to keep believing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look at you, you're shaking.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't help it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What have I got to hide?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Huh? What the hell's the matter with you, Kate?
segments.speaker: M
